file_content.text: Do not return until Kandhar is dead.
I see you found what the fish-dog could not. You think this means you can best me?
You underestimate her intelligence, my love. No mere woman could presume to try matching the achievements of the great Shai Tenna.
You underestimate his intelligence. Even the lowest fool could never think he's in the same league as the great Shai Tenna, my love.
This is Alilia, slave of my body and queen of my heart. The best treasure I ever plundered.
So you have heard my name across the galaxy? Do they say it with fear?
You're the most famous Hothian Weequay pirate I've ever heard of.
Absolutely. [Lie.]
Your reputation is equal to your greatness, my love and lord.
I heard the White Maw might have room for someone like me.
I want to join you.
I have heard of you, too. The starship captain who came from nowhere to recover the treasure of Nok Drayen.
Compared to Rogun the Butcher and Nok Drayen, you're small-time.
Never heard of you.
Yes, Nok Drayen. Word of your success there reaches far.
It is a great triumph for a woman. You could be of value to the White Maw.
A man like you could be a great asset to the White Maw.
Why do I feel like it won't be this easy?
What's the catch?
Ah, a smart one. The Gen'Dai run the White Maw. To get their notice, you must first help me, no?
You have no idea what a compliment that is.
Not really high praise.
You're right. He has no idea.
The Gen'Dai run the White Maw, and they leave it to me to recruit. If you want my help, you help me, first.
You'd be lucky to have me.
Be grateful.
Ah, so true. But the Gen'Dai, they run the White Maw. It is their decision, and they wisely leave it to me. You want my help, you help me, first.
Woman! You tell her.
Woman! You tell him.
My love and lord has a rival, a Devaronian named Kandhar.
He brought cold-weather droids and blaster rifles. The Gen'Dai like this very, very much.
Kandhar has taken favor away from my love and lord. So, to gain his help, you must eliminate the threat from Kandhar, first.
I wouldn't want to see anyone stop your meteoric rise.
Fine.
Do not return here until he is taken care of.
I'm not going to kill a man in cold blood.
I'm no assassin.
Ah, but on Hoth, there is no other way.
I'm here to serve the White Maw, not your ambition.
I don't play these games.
But serving my ambition is your only way in.
Kandhar can be dead or eating through a tube--but until then, you get no further into the White Maw than this room.
Woman, tell her where to find Kandhar. I have business.
Woman, tell him what to do with Kandhar. I am needed elsewhere.
That drooling idiot knows nothing about Kandhar or what he's asking you to take on.
Kandhar got those droids through his alliance with the Empire. He's planning to put his whole gang to work for them in return for help ousting the Gen'Dai.
I thought the White Maw had no use for the Republic or the Empire.
He's an Imperial?
Exactly.
What happened to "my love and lord"?
That's a change.
I've been a slave for seven years. I've learned what he wants me to say, but that doesn't mean I've forgotten how to listen.
You ever thought of escaping, putting those talents to work somewhere else?
[Flirt] You're good.
Are you making an offer? Show me you're a sure thing, and we'll talk.
I'm not afraid of some Imperial sellout.
Just tell me where he is.
I'm not trying to scare you. This is an opportunity.
The pirates here like being independent. If you expose this deal, Kandhar's own men will tear him apart.
There's a secret tunnel in the mines nearby; it leads to the spot where Kandhar meets his Imperial supplier.
Hide inside long enough, you should be able to catch him in the act. Kill him or expose him as you like.
